meanings.definition: The quality of being strange or frightening.
meanings.sent1: The eeriness of the old abandoned house sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The eerie silence of the forest at night filled me with unease.
meanings.sent3: The Halloween decorations added an eerie touch to the party.
meanings.sent4: The eeriness of the fog made it feel like we were in a ghostly realm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie glow of the moon cast an eerie light on the dark path.

meanings.definition: A feeling of unease or fear.
meanings.sent1: Walking through the graveyard, I couldn't shake off the eeriness in the air.
meanings.sent2: The eeriness in her voice made me hesitant to enter the dark room.
meanings.sent3: Despite knowing it was just a movie, the eeriness of the horror film made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The eeriness of the unknown sent a chill down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The eerie shadows in the alley added to the eeriness of the night.
